discover.instruction: Read about two cities. Notice how they are compared.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о двух городах. Обрати внимание, как они сравниваются.

content.text: Tokyo and Paris are both amazing cities, but they are different. Tokyo is <highlight>bigger</highlight> than Paris. It's also <highlight>more crowded</highlight>. Paris is <highlight>older</highlight> than Tokyo. The buildings in Paris are <highlight>more beautiful</highlight>. Tokyo is <highlight>more expensive</highlight> than Paris. The food in Tokyo is <highlight>cheaper</highlight>. Paris is <highlight>more romantic</highlight>. Tokyo is <highlight>faster</highlight> and <highlight>more modern</highlight>. Both cities are great, but Tokyo is <highlight>better</highlight> for technology lovers.
content.question: How do we make comparatives? What patterns do you see?
content.question_ru: Как мы образуем сравнительную степень? Какие закономерности ты видишь?

points.example: tall → taller, fast → faster, old → older
big → bigger, hot → hotter, thin → thinner
happy → happier, easy → easier, busy → busier
beautiful → more beautiful, expensive → more expensive

points.rule: Irregular: good → better, bad → worse, far → farther
points.rule_ru: Неправильные: good → better, bad → worse, far → farther

notice.instruction: Find all comparatives. Identify the rule used for each.
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все сравнительные формы. Определи правило для каждой.

tasks.text: My new apartment is better than my old one. It's bigger and brighter. The rooms are nicer. The kitchen is more modern. It's closer to my work, so I get there faster. The neighborhood is quieter and safer. The rent is higher, but it's more comfortable. I'm happier here. My old place was cheaper, but this one is much better!

notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему 'bigger' (с двумя g), но 'taller' (с одной l)?

sentences.sentence: This book is ___ (interesting) than that one.
This test was ___ (easy) than I expected.

questions.sentence: This movie is ___ than the book.
This car is ___ than that one.

sentences.incorrect: She is more tall than me.

produce.instruction: Compare two things (cities, people, or objects).
produce.instruction_ru: Сравни две вещи (города, людей или предметы).
prompts: Compare two friends or family members
produce.example: Moscow and Saint Petersburg are both beautiful cities. Moscow is bigger than Saint Petersburg. It's more crowded too. But Saint Petersburg is older and more romantic. The architecture is more beautiful. Moscow is faster and more modern. The metro is better in Moscow. Both cities are great, but I prefer Saint Petersburg.
criteria: Uses more + adjective for long ones

texts.title: New vs Old Phone
texts.content: My new phone is so much better than my old one! It's faster and lighter. The screen is bigger and brighter. The camera is more powerful. The battery lasts longer. It was more expensive, but it's worth it. My old phone was slower and older. The storage was smaller too. I'm happier with this new one.

texts.title: Country vs City Life
texts.content: Country life is very different from city life. The countryside is quieter and more peaceful. The air is cleaner. People are friendlier. Life is slower but more relaxing. Cities are busier and more stressful. But cities are more exciting. There are more things to do. Jobs are easier to find. Which is better? It depends on what you want!

texts.title: Comparing Siblings
texts.content: My sister and I are very different. She is taller than me. She is also thinner. I am older but she is more organized. She studies harder. I am funnier and more creative. She is better at math. I am better at languages. She is quieter but I am more sociable. We are different but we love each other!

texts.title: Restaurant Review
texts.content: I tried two Italian restaurants this week. Mario's is cheaper than Luigi's. The portions are bigger. But Luigi's is more elegant. The pasta is tastier. The service is better and faster. The atmosphere is nicer. Mario's is noisier and more crowded. For a romantic dinner, Luigi's is better. For a quick meal, Mario's is more convenient.

texts.title: Summer vs Winter
texts.content: I prefer summer to winter. Summer is warmer and brighter. Days are longer. I feel happier and more energetic. Winter is colder and darker. But winter is more romantic. The holidays are more special. Hot chocolate tastes better in winter. Both seasons are beautiful in different ways.

grammar_cards.front:
Find the error:
"She is more tall than me."
grammar_cards.back:
She is taller than me.

Short adjective → +er

common_errors: Using more with short adjectives (more tall)
Not doubling consonant (biger instead of bigger)
